name: Mercer
tagline: Global HR and benefits advisory—advising on talent, health, retirement, and investments
description: At Mercer, A Marsh business, we're helping our clients realize their investment objectives, shape the future of work, and enhance health and retirement outcomes for their people. As a business of Marsh, for 80 years, we've been helping our clients, colleagues and communities build the confidence to thrive, creating healthier and more sustainable futures. Together with Marsh Risk, Guy Carpenter, and Oliver Wyman, we help organizations build resilience and competitive advantages from every angle. With annual revenue over $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues in 130 countries, Marsh helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective.
known_for: One of the world's largest HR consulting firms with deep expertise in workforce strategy, retirement planning, and employee benefits. Known for quantitative rigor in compensation benchmarking and actuarial analysis, collaborative culture, and better work-life balance than traditional strategy consulting.
career_path: Analyst (2-3 yrs) → Associate (2-3 yrs) → Senior Associate (3-4 yrs) → Principal (4-5 yrs) → Senior Principal (4+ yrs) → Partner

recruiting.process: Resume → Phone/Video Screen (behavioral) → First Round (1-2 case + behavioral) → Final Round (3-4 case + behavioral interviews)
recruiting.unique: Heavy emphasis on fit and cultural alignment; cases focus on HR/benefits scenarios rather than traditional business strategy; less competitive than MBB but still rigorous
recruiting.timeline: MBA applications July-September, interviews August-October; undergraduate applications vary by school

byu.tip: Strong BYU alumni network (280+ all-time) but no active on-campus recruiting. Leverage alumni connections for informational interviews and referrals. Focus on HR consulting and benefits expertise to differentiate.
